metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16357 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - untriaged
metadata.Description:
In radare 2.0.1, a memory corruption vulnerability exists instore_versioninfo_gnu_verdef() and store_versioninfo_gnu_verneed() inlibr/bin/format/elf/elf.c, as demonstrated by an invalid free. This erroris due to improper sh_size validation when allocating memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16357` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-2.3 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: radare2 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
